Key Arguments: The legislation grants excessive power to the government, allowing it to become the arbiter of truth.
The government is exempt from accountability for its own misinformation and disinformation.
Historical examples, such as the Iraq War, demonstrate the dangers of government misinformation.
The proposal could lead to censorship and suppression of free speech.
The use of euphemisms and jargon by the government manipulates public perception.
Notable Quotes: The answer to bad speech is more good speech. NOT CENSORSHIP!
Granting a sweeping powers to government to combat misinformation and disinformation gives it the license to become the arbiter of truth.
Under this draft to Combat ‘Misinformation and Disinformation’ the government is specifically exempt from being held accountable for misinformation and disinformation it may spread.
